page.title: 09GREYWELL AND THE CASTLE
page.content: Greywell Village is situated west of North Warnborough Village. The area is mainly rough grazing land with some cultivated crops.There is a small area of wet and boggy land. Hockley's Farm and Adam's Farm are situated on the road into North Warnborough. The Alder Valley bus service, 201, passes through this area to Basingstoke. A single track lane, suitable for light vehicles, leads to the Basingstoke Canal, where there is a ford and a swing bridge. A network of designated foot-paths and tow-paths cover the area. There are 84 houses in the area. A large, open space is used as a public playing field. Odiham Castle, locally called, "King John's Castle" is an ancient monument, by the side of the canal. The canal crosses the River Whitewater using an aqueduct nearby.
